intro: Alchemilla gingolphiana, commonly known as the Swiss penny-cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported healing properties. Alchemilla gingolphiana thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
